snippet: The New York State public retirement system needs short-term relief as well as long-term reforms.
abstract: Editorial supports New York State's proposed relief program for its public-employee pension system, which will allow employers to pay a portion of their yearly contributions to the pension fund and pay the remainder in installments with interest over a decade; holds that this short-term relief is needed to get through the current budget crunch, but solving the longer-term pension problem depends on broad reforms.
lead_paragraph: The New York State public retirement system needs short-term relief as well as long-term reforms.
